node.title: 'Scientifically unjustified': African leaders call for urgent lifting of Omicron travel bans
node.alt: A man in a suit gestures at a lectern
node.description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa is calling on countries to "immediately and urgently" reverse travel bans following the discovery of the new coronavirus variant Omicron.
node.content:
["South African President Cyril Ramaphosa is calling on countries to \"immediately and urgently\" reverse travel bans following the\u00a0discovery of the new Omicron coronavirus variant.", "Dozens of nations have blacklisted South Africa and its neighbouring countries in the wake of\u00a0South African scientists flagging\u00a0the Omicron strain on November 25.", "The flight bans have angered several African leaders, with Mr Ramaphosa slamming the moves as\u00a0scientifically \"unjustified\".", "\"We call upon all those countries that have imposed travel bans on our country and our southern African sister countries to immediately and urgently reverse their decisions before any further damage is done on our economies and to the livelihoods of our people,\"\u00a0Mr Ramaphosa said.", "The World Health Organization (WHO) has labelled Omicron a variant of concern.\u00a0Scientists are still assessing its virulence.", "The countries that have already imposed travel restrictions on southern Africa include key travel hubs such as\u00a0Qatar, the United States, Britain, Saudi Arabia, Kuwait and the Netherlands.", "
Malawi's President slams 'Afrophobia'
", "Malawian President Lazarus Chakwera accused Western countries of \"Afrophobia\" for shutting their borders.", "In Botswana, the other southern African country to detect the strain \u2014\u00a0among a group of foreign diplomatic visitors in the first instance \u2014\u00a0two ministers cautioned against \"geo-politicising this virus\".", "", "
New COVID-19 variant emerges in South Africa
", "\"We are concerned that there seem to have been attempts to stigmatise the country where it was detected,\" Health Minister Edwin Dikoloti said.", "The head of the WHO in Africa,\u00a0Matshidiso Moeti, was equally worried.", "Mr Ramaphosa warned travel bans would \"further damage the economies and\u00a0undermine their ability to respond to and recover from the pandemic\".", "South Africa, the continent's most industrialised country, is struggling with slow economic growth and a more than 34 per cent unemployment rate.", "The travel curbs are another major blow to its key tourism industry, which had set high hopes on the upcoming southern hemisphere summer.", "South Africa is has been the African country worst hit by COVID-19, with around 2.9 million cases and 89,797 deaths reported to date.", "Omicron is believed to be fuelling a rise in infections, with 1,600 new cases recorded on average in the past seven days compared to 500 the previous week.", "AFP", "", "
What COVID-19 travel insurance doesn't cover you for(Emilia Terzon)
"]
